Well New Years brought me... Tears. Wonderful but I guess that is expected when you have no one to celebrate it with. I didn't even get a pity invite to any celebrations. I know that it is one of the most over-rated days, second only to valentines day, but I just can't help but want to celebrate it, do all those cool things people do to see the new year in but it always ends up being a very lonely night. This year just seems to heighten the loneliness. Christmas is a day for families and New Years is a day for friends. I'm used to Christmas being shit with my family, they always let me down and vice versa but its the day for going out and hanging with friends but it always ends up either being alone, the pity invite or I'm just the girl on the outskirts looking in, never been really incorporated.

It doesn't help that lately I've been realising how little I fit into the lives of any of my close friends anymore. I don't have a hubby and children so I get shunned by those friends who do and forgotten about. I don't live in an awesome place with a cool social life or anything like that so don't really get a look in by those friends that do.

I don't fit into any of their worlds anymore and I feel like the hanger-on who tires and tries and tries but am never really part of any world I am trying to fit into. I feel like I'm the friend people have because they don't know how to get rid of me. Old friends are hard to cut off. But the drifting away from them one by one, year by year is slowly killing me and certainly driving me insane.

I'm the loner. I grew up alone with no one ever at home. The girl that moved every year or so so never kept any friends. The girl forced to keep everyone at arms length because it made the enviable easier to deal with. The loneliness it just so hard. Why is life just skipping me by.

What is about me that makes people exclude me? I really wish someone would just grow some balls and tell me. I can't change unless I know what the problem is. It's obviously something.

Then there's this other friend who is fighting so hard to tell me how much our friendship means to her just about every time we talk. I feel like she is trying to convince herself not me. She seems like she's trying to refuse to accept that our friendship is drifting apart. At least she's fighting as much as I am but should a friendship be like this after almost 18 years?

I'm just making my head go around in circles now. Also I'm starting to to make sense to myself. I'll update about Christmas and Chch in the morning when hopefully I'm in a slightly better mood. It's almost 3, I better get some sleep. Think I might need it.
